15:40 <vmassol> has quit  
15:48 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: ping  
16:00 <+mflorea> I believe http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWikiOrgCode/LatestBlogPosts is cached for a too long period and so we miss the real latest blog posts... I'm not sure how to clear the cache  
16:02 <@sdumitriu> Pong  
16:03 <@sdumitriu> WTF happened on platform/master?  
16:04 <@sdumitriu> I'll try to fix it  
16:04 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: I don't really know how to refresh the rendering cache, I know two solutions  
16:05 <@sdumitriu> 1. Edit the page and change the cache ID, if it has one  
16:05 <@sdumitriu> 2. Edit the page and slightly change the content otherwise  
16:05 <tmortagne> you mean cache macro ?  
16:05 <+mflorea> tmortagne: yes  
16:06 <tmortagne> yea I don't think cache macro has anything to force refreshing it (rendering cache supports a URL parameter for it)  
16:09 <tmortagne> the easiest is to restart :)  
16:13 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: modifying the cache id worked  
16:17 <mflorea> has quit  
16:19 <CIA-114> Ludovic Dubost master \* r05c74fa https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/05c74fa69ac6b5eed3b4db390d9ecd319eff31a0 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/api/Document.java : XWIKI-8118 - Improved javadoc of the com.xpn.xwiki.api classes - https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/05c74fa69ac6b5eed3b4db390d9ecd319eff31a0  
16:20 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: I fixed the master branch, but your last commit was lost  
16:20 <@sdumitriu> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/974ea762506d9ef1172eaaf17ffb06910e08cae6  
16:20 <@sdumitriu> Can you re-commit it?  
16:20 <tmortagne> sdumitriu: yep, doing it now  
16:24 <@sdumitriu> I think this one as well: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/deb01b51fa18c34848c7a4769918eba04ea91ba2  
16:26 <tmortagne> will git pull go crazy with this missing history ?  
16:26 <@sdumitriu> I hope not...  
16:27 <@sdumitriu> Normally it should leave your two commits ready to be pushed  
16:27 <@sdumitriu> Let me know if you get something wrong after the pull  
16:27 <@sdumitriu> Actually make sure you do git pull --rebase  
16:27 <tmortagne> anyway will copy all the files I modied today in case of there is something weird  
16:28 <tmortagne> I have --rebase by default  
16:28 <@sdumitriu> Perfect  
16:28 <tmortagne> indeed that should probably do it  
16:28 <tmortagne> lets see  
16:33 <tmortagne> git pull removed all my modifications  
16:33 <tmortagne> restoring them  
16:34 <@sdumitriu> You should be able to do:  
16:34 <@sdumitriu> git cherry-pick deb01b51fa18c34848c7a4769918eba04ea91ba2  
16:34 <@sdumitriu> git cherry-pick 974ea762506d9ef1172eaaf17ffb06910e08cae6  
16:34 <tmortagne> you think they still exist somewhere ?  
16:34 <@sdumitriu> Yes, they should be on your computer  
16:34 <tmortagne> yep works well  
16:35 <@sdumitriu> pull doesn't remove objects from your database  
16:35 <@sdumitriu> Only git gc does that  
16:35 <tmortagne> perfect  
16:35 <@sdumitriu> Unfortunately, I didn't have them locally, since I just pulled after the bad revert  
16:35 <tmortagne> pushing

16:36 <@sdumitriu> Going for breakfast
